items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the toString member of the HTMLAnchorElement API, based upon manual testing.

Test Code Used: var el = document.createElement('a'); var href = 'https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/'; el.href = href; el.toString() == href;
items.title: Add Safari versions for api.HTMLAnchorElement.toString

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Chrome and Safari for the DataTransfer API, based upon commit history and date.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/88da2cf32110d94f0e062156113954b24362c8c4
items.title: Add Chrome/Safari versions for DataTransfer API

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the name member of the DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope API, based upon commit history and date.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/88937c31aa017301a3856a076fe283a3b9012e9c
items.title: Add Chromium versions for api.DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope.name

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds array findLast and findLastIndex entries to the data.

Test results and supporting details

https://webkit.org/blog/11971/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-132/#:~:text=Enabled%20Array%23findLast%20method
items.title: Add array findLast and findLastIndex

items.content_html:
Summary

Set Safari preview support for additions in TP132

Test results and supporting details

https://webkit.org/blog/11971/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-132/
items.title: Safari TP 132 additions
Update the spec URL for navigator.keyboard

items.content_html: This PR removes the MediaStreamConstraints dictionary from BCD, folding its two parameters into the only function that uses it (api.MediaDevices.getUserMedia). This is also preliminary work for the removal of the MediaTrackConstraints dictionary as well.
items.title: Remove MediaStreamConstraints dictionary from BCD

items.content_html:
https://w3c.github.io/webcodecs/#imagedecoder-interface doesn’t show any type attribute for the ImageDecoder interface/object.

Maybe this was supposed to be for isTypeSupported?
items.title: Drop the “type” attribute from ImageDecoder

items.content_html: This PR removes both the BasicCardRequest and BasicCardResponse dictionaries from BCD.
items.title: Remove BasicCard[Request/Response] dictionaries from BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

color-mix() is behind a flag in Safari 15.

Test results and supporting details

  • https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/273244/webkit/
  • https://webkit.org/blog/11577/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-122/#post-11577:~:text=CSS%20Color,-Added

I also installed Safari 15 (beta) on my device, and verified the flag is there and works as expected.

Related issues

N/A
items.title: Add safari version for css color-mix()

items.content_html: This PR removes the CryptoKeyPair dictionary from BCD.
items.title: Remove CryptoKeyPair dictionary from BCD

items.content_html:
FF93 added the event handler onslotchange to ShadowRoot and also the GlobalEventHandler. This PR adds the version to FF for ShadowRoot and creates new entry for the GlobalEvent Handler.

Note, I have set this as experimental, as only one implementation

  • FF bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1501983. I have also tested this and verified in FF93 (and not present in FF92)
  • Tested Chrome and it is not present - intent to ship is recent and here: https://groups.google.com/a/mozilla.org/g/dev-platform/c/tHIn-Ce1DSE
  • Safari is in preview apparently https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=191310 though I have not tested this.
  • Other docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#8624
items.title: FF93 onslotchange to globalevents and shadowroot

items.content_html:
This adds securitypolicyviolation_event to the Element API as a follow on from #12289.

This appears to have been a long term omission.

  • I have added it to Element because that is what the spec says here
  • I have matched the versions of the associated event object SecurityPolicyViolationEvent which I would have expected to have been added at the same time.
  • I did not add the spec URL because it causes an assertion error: "spec_url": "https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#event-securitypolicyviolation",
items.title: Add Element securitypolicyviolation_event

items.content_html:
Summary

Sets scrollbar gutter support for Chrome, Chrome Android, WebView Android and Edge 94.

Test results and supporting details

https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5746559209701376
items.title: Add Scrollbar Gutter support for blink 94

items.content_html:
Summary

Remove erroneous samsung internet webauthn support

Test results and supporting details

WebAuthn isn't implemented in Samsung Internet, the current support data seems to have been incorrectly copied over from Chrome support data. webauthn.io shows an unsupported error and none of the interfaces are exposed.

(The support data for the Credential and CredentialsContainer interface is correct however)
items.title: Set WebAuthn APIs as unsupported in Samsung Internet

items.content_html:
Summary

Set WebAuthn APIs as supported in Opera Desktop

Test results and supporting details

This copies across Chrome desktop support to Opera in the places it was missing.
items.title: Set WebAuthn APIs as supported in Opera Desktop

items.content_html:
Summary

This updates Firefox Android support for WebAuthn related APIs.

I've set them all as fully supported in Firefox 92. And left the preview entries as partial implementations.

I will file off an issue to investigate the extent of the implementation pre-92. I know that it was partially implemented as it passes basic feature detection but fails weirdly on https://webauthn.io

Test results and supporting details

Tested on https://webauthn.io

And https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/android/92.0/releasenotes/#:~:text=Added%20support%20for%20Web%20Authentication%20API
items.title: Set WebAuthn APIs as supported in Firefox Android 92

items.content_html:
Summary

Unmarks webauthn APIs with cross-browser support as no longer experimental

Also marks some Webauthn APIs with only Chromium support as experimental

Test results and supporting details

Just based on existing support data

Related issues
items.title: Set WebAuthn APIs as no longer experimental
